CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PSC: Photovoltaic Solar Cell
2. Terpolymer: A type of polymer made from three different monomers.
3. T / 2T ratio: Ratio of two types of monomers in the terpolymer.
4. J sc: Short for Short-Circuit Current, a measure of the maximum current a solar cell can produce under standard test conditions.
5. mA cm^-2: Milliamperes per square centimeter.
6. FF: Fill Factor, a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell at converting sunlight into electricity.
7. PCE: Power Conversion Efficiency, a measure of how effectively a solar cell converts sunlight into electricity.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PSC: Photovoltaic Solar Cell
2. T/2T ratio: Ratio of two types of monomers T in a terpolymer
3. J sc: Short for Short-Circuit Current Density
4. mA cm^-2: Units of Short-Circuit Current Density
5. %: Percentage
6. FF: Fill Factor
7. 7 : 3: Ratio of T monomers in the optimized terpolymer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PSC: Photovoltaic Solar Cell
2. J sc: Short-Circuit Current Density
3. FF: Fill Factor
4. 18.3 mA cm^-2: Value of Short-Circuit Current Density
5. 71.2%: Value of Fill Factor
6. 10.8%: Value of Enhanced PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
7. T/2T ratio: Ratio of monomers in the optimized terpolymer (relevant as it affects the material properties)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Photovoltaic Solar Cell (PSC) |
| Short-Circuit Current Density (J sc) |
| Fill Factor (FF) |
| 18.3 mA cm^-2 (Value of Short-Circuit Current Density) |
| 71.2% (Value of Fill Factor) |
| Enhanced PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) (10.8%) |
| T/2T ratio (Ratio of monomers in the optimized terpolymer) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PSC: Photovoltaic Solar Cell
2. T / 2T ratio: The ratio of Terpolymer T to Terpolymer 2T
3. 7 : 3: The specific optimized ratio of T to 2T
4. 18.3 mA cm^-2: The J sc value (Junction Scanning Current density)
5. 71.2%: The Fill Factor (FF)
6. 10.8%: The Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. J sc: 18.3 mA cm^-2
2. FF: 71.2%
3. PCE: 10.8%

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to the values of material properties. The other entities, such as "PSC," "terpolymer," "T," "2T," and "ratio," are not material properties but rather contextual information.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| J sc: 18.3 mA cm^-2 |
| FF: 71.2% |
| PCE: 10.8% |
